intro: Rostellularia pumila, commonly known as the small rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or along streams. Rostellularia pumila is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
